title: 135 in ISA
content: I have scored 135 marks in ISA 1 (including constitution), I am planning on targeting 35 as the avg in ISA and around 87 avg in ESA. Although this feels like a stretch but I just want some assurance that this can be achieved.

comments.body:
See instead of like setting a marks target for yourself, figure out which subjects you messed up in(For me last sem was EPD and chem), and switch approaches to those subjects(To the approach that you used to get marks in whichever subject you got marks) and the marks will automatically come. ESA was quite difficult for chem cycle ppl(It did not come like the pyqs) so don’t just go off pyqs while studying for it, you have to do everything completely. Also remember there is nothing like important topic or etc.(They asked questions from random-ass topics). 


So TLDR is yes it’s possible but will require massive changes in prep strategies and a lot of effort

For refrence I pulled a similar comeback myself :)
